column4: hi all. I have 3 SCSI HDD. then I want mount / to 1st SCSI. /home to second and third SCSI together. is it possible?
I tried google, but not found. where is nice howto?
Mounting / to the first SCSI and its partition should be easy..
then you want to mount /home over the remaining 2 SCSI drives together?
then I think you need to raid those 2
and then mount /home to that patition spanning over those 2 discs
Tulga so what you want to look for is how to raid those 2 SCSI disks and partion them and then how to change so that /home is mounted on that partition
aye Frogzoo is right. If you raid 5 those 2 disks together you mirror them between them. That means that you only will use half of them though so
those 2's diskspace will become disk1+disk2 / 2 of amount
but it is priceless if one of the harddrives break and have all data still there
